cmExperiment::cmExperiment ( QString  strClientName,
QObject *  parent = 0,
const char *  name = 0 
)

Creates an object to a MIDAS experiment.

Parameters:
strClientName Name of the client which connects to the experiment, e.g. 'hvEdit'
parent The parent of an object may be viewed as the object's owner. Setting parent to 0 constructs an object with no parent. If the object is a widget, it will become a top-level window.
name Name of the object. The object name is some text that can be used to identify a QObject.

BOOL cmExperiment::Connect ( QString  strHostName,
QString  strExperimentName,
QString  strClientName 
)

Establishes the connection to a MIDAS experiment, running on the host strHostName.

return:

  • TRUE, if connection to the experiment is established
  • FALSE, otherwise
Parameters:
strHostName Name of the host on which the MIDAS experiment runs.
strExperimentName Name of the MIDAS experiment to which one wants to connect
strClientName Name of the client which connects to the experiment, e.g. 'hvEdit'

BOOL cmExperiment::StartTimer (  ) 

Since all MIDAS clients cyclically have to tell that they are still alive, such a cyclical timer is needed, which is implemented here. This cyclic timer works the following way: Once it is started, it runs in the background till timeout is reached. At timeout it calls a time out routine (timeOutProc) and the whole things starts all over again.

return:

  • TRUE if timer could have been started
  • FALSE otherwise

Definition at line 180 of file cmExperiment.cpp.

References FALSE, m_bTimerStarted, MidasMessage(), timeout, timeOutProc(), timer, and TRUE.

Referenced by cmKey::HotLink().

00189   connect(timer, SIGNAL(timeout()), SLOT(timeOutProc()));
00190 
00191   // start timer
00192   if (!timer->start(500)) {
00193     MidasMessage("Cannot set timer");
00194     return FALSE;
00195   }
00196 
00197   m_bTimerStarted = TRUE;
00198 
00199   return TRUE;
00200 }

void cmExperiment::timeOutProc (  )  [private, slot]

This routine is the time out routine of StartTimer and is cyclically called. It self tells MIDAS that hvEdit is still alive and checks if MIDAS itself is alive and if MIDAS (for what ever reason) kick hvEdit out.

return: void

Definition at line 211 of file cmExperiment.cpp.

References cm_yield(), MidasMessage(), RPC_SHUTDOWN, SS_ABORT, and status.

Referenced by StartTimer().

00218   // check if MIDAS itself is still alive
00219   // check further if MIDAS did not through hvEdit out
00220   if (status == SS_ABORT || status == RPC_SHUTDOWN) {
00221     MidasMessage("Lost connection to the host");
00222   }
